title: Excel Highlight Cell Rules - Between

metadata.description: Learn about Excel Highlight Cell Rules - Between with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Highlight Cell Rules - Between
Highlight Cell Rules is a premade type of conditional formatting in Excel used to change the appearance of cells in a range based on your specified
conditions
.
Between...
is one of the options for the condition.
Here is the Highlight Cell Rules part of the conditional formatting menu:
Highlight Cell Rule - Between Example
The "Between..." Highlight Cell Rule will highlight a cell with one of the appearance options based on the cell value being
between
two specified values.
The specified values are typically numbers, but can also be text values.
In this example, the specified values will be "79" and "100".
Name	Type 1	HP	Attack	Defense	Sp. Atk	Sp. Def	Speed
        Magikarp	Water	20	10	55	15	20	80
        Gyarados	Water	95	125	79	60	100	81
        Lapras	Water	130	85	80	85	95	60
        Ditto	Normal	48	48	48	48	48	48
        Eevee	Normal	55	55	50	45	65	55
        Vaporeon	Water	130	65	60	110	95	65
        Jolteon	Electric	65	65	60	110	95	130
Copy Values
You can
choose any range
for where the Highlight Cell Rule should apply. It can be a few cells, a single column, a single row, or a combination of multiple cells, rows and columns.
Let's apply the rule to all of the different stat values.
"Between..." Highlight Cell Rule, step by step:
Select the range
C2:H8
for all of the stat values
Click on the Conditional Formatting icon
in the ribbon, from
Home
menu
Select
Highlight Cell Rules
from the drop-down menu
Select
Between...
from the menu
This will open a dialog box where you can specify the value and the appearance option.
Enter
79
and
100
into the input fields
Select the appearance option "Yellow Fill with Dark Yellow Text" from the dropdown menu
Now, the cells with values between "79" and "100" will be highlighted in yellow:
Notice that Gyarados' Defense and Special Defense, which are 79 and 100, are highlighted.
The
Between...
condition
includes
the specified values. This is different from the
Greater Than...
and
Less Than...
conditions, which do
not
include the specified values.
Note:
You can remove the Highlight Cell Rules with
Manage Rules
.

★
+1

quiz.question:
What is Between
Highlight Cell Rules?
options:
Not a Between
Highlight Cell Rules.

a premade type of conditional formatting in Excel used to change the appearance of cells in a range based on your specified
conditions
quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of Between
Highlight Cell Rules is 'a premade type of conditional formatting in Excel used to change the appearance of cells in a range based on your specified
conditions'.

quiz.question: Which best describes the main purpose of this c feature?
quiz.explanation: This feature serves multiple purposes in software development.

summary: This tutorial covers Excel Highlight Cell Rules - Between concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use Excel Highlight Cell Rules - Between effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of Excel Highlight Cell Rules - Between and how to apply it in your projects.
